TopicTitle: Morning laugh: Polar Bears on Mars

Articles.Content:
This one is good for a chuckle over your coffee and biscuits. The morning news is better than the comedy channel.

[h=1]'Baby bear' spotted on Mars; UN to be alerted[/h]
Just looking at the link, I thought that it would go to the Onion. Why do people believe this stuff?

I'd love to say it's because people are really, really stupid, but while that is probably a really big part of it, our brains are wired to see familiar patterns.

People who aren't stupid, though, can see the pattern and recognize that it's a coincidence, and not really a face, a squirrel, or in this case, a miniature Martian polar bear.

Edited October 29, 2015 by Torgo
But I thought this was the Onion....People seriously believe this ****?
Seeing something is one thing (pareidolia), but making these claims is being stupid. So yeah, these people are stupid.

So yeah, these people are stupid.

Think of it as a free entertainment source.

Also from the same website, and article of WT1190F-

-They misspelled WT1990F as ...1990F (probably not intentional, which makes it worse)

-"There is lot of man-made junk, left pieces of rockets in the sky but WT1190F will be the first ever unknown object to be crashed on earth."

Oh please.

*another picture is taken of same spot, and "polar bear" is still there.*

"Well, it's obviously hibernating, you see. Given the harshness of the martian weather, I'm not surprised that martian bears can enter such an advanced state of hibernation."

*Another picture taken from a different angle. Reveals "polar bear" to be a generic rock formation.*

Either

A. "See! It's gone! It must have woken up and walked away!"

B. "NASA just photoshopped the images. They don't want us to know the truth."

The truth, of course, is that there are some crazy people out there.
